questions.q: A program is a _____ entity, while a process is an _____ entity.
questions.explanation: A program is a passive entity stored on a disk (executable file), whereas a process is an active entity [17, 18].

questions.q: Which section of a process in memory contains global variables?
questions.explanation: The parts of a process include the text section (code), stack (temporary data), data section (global variables), and heap (dynamically allocated memory) [19].

questions.q: Which process state defines a process that is waiting to be assigned to a processor?
questions.explanation: A process is in the 'ready' state when it is waiting to be assigned to a processor [20].

questions.q: What information is NOT typically stored in a Process Control Block (PCB)?
questions.explanation: A PCB (or task control block) contains process state, program counter, CPU registers, CPU scheduling info, memory-management info, accounting info, and I/O status info [21].

questions.q: Which scheduler is invoked infrequently (seconds or minutes) and controls the degree of multiprogramming?
questions.explanation: The long-term scheduler (or job scheduler) is invoked infrequently and controls the degree of multiprogramming [22].

questions.q: What is the primary drawback of a context switch?
options: It changes the process state to 'new'
It represents overhead as the system does no useful work while switching
It increases the degree of multiprogramming
It requires a shared memory mailbox
questions.explanation: Context-switch time is overhead because the system does no useful work while saving the state of an old process and loading the state for a new one [23].

questions.q: In UNIX, which system call is used to create a new process?
questions.explanation: In UNIX systems, the fork() system call is used to create a new process [24].

options: A process that has no parent
A process that has finished execution but whose parent has not yet called wait()
A process that runs indefinitely in the background
A process that has been swapped out to disk
questions.explanation: If a process has terminated but its parent has not yet invoked wait(), the process is known as a zombie [25].

questions.q: The Google Chrome browser uses a multiprocess architecture. What does the 'Renderer' process handle?
options: Managing user interface and disk I/O
Rendering web pages and dealing with HTML/Javascript
Allocating CPU cycles to other tabs
questions.explanation: In Chrome's multiprocess architecture, the Renderer process renders web pages and handles HTML and Javascript [26].

questions.q: What are the two primary models of Interprocess Communication (IPC)?
questions.explanation: There are two models of IPC: shared memory and message passing [27, 28].

questions.q: In message passing, what type of communication requires processes to name each other explicitly?
questions.explanation: With direct communication, processes must name each other explicitly to send or receive messages [29].

questions.q: Which statement about Named Pipes is true?
options: They are bidirectional and do not require a parent-child relationship
They cannot be used on Windows systems
questions.explanation: Named pipes are more powerful than ordinary pipes; they are bidirectional and no parent-child relationship is necessary [30].
